casebody.data:
MISCELLANEOUS DISMISSALS

97-1147. State v. Scott.

Clark App. No. 95CA101. Appellant has filed an untimely appeal of the court of appeals’ decision affirming the trial court’s order revoking his probation, and a motion for delayed appeal. This appeal involves a civil, post-conviction matter and not an appeal of a felony case to which the provisions for *1414delayed appeal in S.Ct.Prae.R. II(2)(A)(4), apply. Accordingly,

IT IS ORDERED by the court, sua sponte, that the motion for delayed appeal be, and hereby is, stricken.

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED by the court, sua sponte, that, in that appellant failed to perfect an appeal pursuant to S.Ct.Prae.R. II(2)(A)(1), this case be, and hereby is, dismissed for lack of jurisdiction.
